org.apps8os.trafficsense.android

Class LocationOnlyService

  • java.lang.Object
    • Service
      • org.apps8os.trafficsense.android.LocationOnlyService
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    com.google.android.gms.common.GooglePlayServicesClient.ConnectionCallbacks, com.google.android.gms.common.GooglePlayServicesClient.OnConnectionFailedListener, com.google.android.gms.location.LocationClient.OnAddGeofencesResultListener, com.google.android.gms.location.LocationClient.OnRemoveGeofencesResultListener

    public class LocationOnlyService
extends Service
implements com.google.android.gms.common.GooglePlayServicesClient.ConnectionCallbacks, com.google.android.gms.common.GooglePlayServicesClient.OnConnectionFailedListener, com.google.android.gms.location.LocationClient.OnAddGeofencesResultListener, com.google.android.gms.location.LocationClient.OnRemoveGeofencesResultListener
    Service that follows a journey based on location.

      • errorOnStart

        private boolean errorOnStart
        Did we encounter an error during onStartCommand(). If true, the service failed to start. onStartCommand() should stopSelf() and onDestroy() should not do the clean up. This would be true if the service is automatically restarted by Android.

    • Method Detail

      • onCreate

        public void onCreate()
        Instantiate various resources.

      • onStartCommand

        public int onStartCommand(Intent intent,
                 int flags,
                 int startId)
        Start rolling the service. The service stops when: 1) Android kills it. 2) errorOnStart is true 3) When the journey ends. NOTE: Availability of Google Play/Location Services is implicitly verified in onAddGeofencesResult(int, String[])

      • onDestroy

        public void onDestroy()
        Clean up. Note that invocation is not guaranteed.

      • addGeofence

        private void addGeofence(java.util.ArrayList<com.google.android.gms.location.Geofence> list)
        Adds a list of GeoFences to the location client. The action taken when GeoFence transition is made is currently hard coded.
        Parameters:
        list - list of GeoFences to be added

      • createGeofence

        private com.google.android.gms.location.Geofence createGeofence(Waypoint busStop,
                                                      java.lang.String id,
                                                      float radius,
                                                      long expiryDuration,
                                                      int transition)
        Returns a GeoFence made from a waypoint
        Parameters:
        busStop - get the longitude and latitude of the waypoint
        id - id of the GeoFence
        radius - the radius of the GeoFence
        expiryDuration - how long the GeoFence exists
        transition - what type of transition triggers alert
        Returns:
        a GeoFence created using the method parameters

      • sendNextWaypointIntent

        protected void sendNextWaypointIntent(java.lang.String message)
        Sends an Intent that indicates current waypoint information has been updated. It may contain a message but it is currently unused. Protected instead of private beacase LocationOnlyService.EnteredWaypointAlertReceiver needs this.
        Parameters:
        message -

      • makeNotificationAndAlert

        protected void makeNotificationAndAlert()
        Updates and shows a notification. If we are on the second last waypoint makes the phone vibrate. Protected instead of private beacase LocationOnlyService.EnteredWaypointAlertReceiver needs this.

      • onBind

        public IBinder onBind(Intent arg0)
        No bind to this service.

      • sendErrorAndExit

        private void sendErrorAndExit(java.lang.String msg)
        Send an Intent indicating an error to listening services and stop the service.
        Parameters:
        msg - error message
